intro.title: Is there evil within each of us and can we be free from it?
intro.description: Many current ideologies, especially in the field of Psychology, claim that the human being is good by nature, and the environment in which he is inserted is to blame for corrupting him. This is not the Bible’s view of man.

appendix.appendixContent:
Genesis 1:26

26 Then God said, “Let Us make man in Our image, according to Our likeness; let them have dominion over the fish of the sea, over the birds of the air, and over the cattle, over all the earth and over every creeping thing that creeps on the earth.”

Genesis 5:3

3 And Adam lived one hundred and thirty years, and begot a son in his own likeness, after his image, and named him Seth.

Romans 5:12

12 Therefore, just as through one man sin entered the world, and death through sin, and thus death spread to all men, because all sinned—

questions.description: Ephesians 2:3 says we are “children of wrath by nature.” As such, we are born with a heritage of inclination to selfishness, pride, and wickedness, which the Bible calls “death” (Romans 5:12). The book of Genesis itself already paints this picture by saying that Adam was created in God’s image and likeness, but his children were born in his image and likeness, inevitably inheriting the consequences of sin (Genesis 1:26 and Genesis 5:3).

questions.questionAppendix: Read Romans 5:12 to answer

answers.text: In fact, everyone is born with an inclination to evil, to death

appendix.appendixContent:
Romans 7:15-16

15 For what I am doing, I do not understand. For what I will to do, that I do not practice; but what I hate, that I do.16 If, then, I do what I will not to do, I agree with the law that it is good.

questions.description: Our condition is so desperate that, biblically speaking, we cannot overcome it alone (Jeremiah 13:23). There is no moral philosophy, mental exercise, or group therapy that can get us rid of this nature that leads us to death. Paul felt it himself when he said that “For what I want to do I do not do, but what I hate I do.” (Romans 7:15-16).
questions.questionTitle: Regarding the human condition, consider the statements below.
questions.questionVersicles: Read Jeremiah 13:23 and Romans 7:15-16 and mark true or false on the following statements:

answers.text: We are taught to do evil
It is very easy and simple to do good
Paul struggled with his sinful nature
Sin is only in the mind of the believer

appendix.appendixContent:
I Corinthians 15:54

54 So when this corruptible has put on incorruption, and this mortal has put on immortality, then shall be brought to pass the saying that is written: “Death is swallowed up in victory.”

Romans 12:1-3

1 I beseech you therefore, brethren, by the mercies of God, that you present your bodies a living sacrifice, holy, acceptable to God, which is your reasonable service.2 And do not be conformed to this world, but be transformed by the renewing of your mind, that you may prove what is that good and acceptable and perfect will of God.3 For I say, through the grace given to me, to everyone who is among you, not to think of himself more highly than he ought to think, but to think soberly, as God has dealt to each one a measure of faith.

Jeremiah 31:33

33 But this is the covenant that I will make with the house of Israel after those days, says the Lord: I will put My law in their minds, and write it on their hearts; and I will be their God, and they shall be My people.

questions.description: According to the Bible, there are only two ways to get rid of this evil. The first is daily seeking and experiencing the presence of Christ that leads to the “transformation of our mind and thoughts,” so that we may live “God’s good and pleasant will.” This means the sacrifice of our self, that Christ may dwell in us (Romans 12:1-3) and His will be engraved in our hearts (Jeremiah 31:33). This will be a daily struggle, but it will culminate in the day when the evil that dwells in us will be wiped out forever. What will happen when Christ returns and our body full of corruption is transformed into a body without corruption (1 Corinthians 15:54).
questions.questionTitle: According to the Bible, what is one way to fight evil?

answers.text: Seeking God’s presence in the days of worship

answers.text: Engraving God’s will in the heart
You do not have to fight evil
